item.title: Nintendo Switch Online Checks Another Big Item Off Players' Wish Lists
item.description:
Nintendo Switch Online is far from a perfect service. Since its 2018 launch, Switch Online has struggled to live up to its Xbox and PlayStation counterparts, with the service lacking common features like party chats and direct messaging. Switch Online's infrastructure has also been a consistent point of criticism over the last six years, with netcode and server issues often causing extreme lag. But one shining beacon over the years has been Nintendo Switch Online's ever-growing library of retro video games.

Beginning with just a handful of NES games, Nintendo Switch Online is now home to over 300 retro titles, encompassing the SNES, Sega Genesis, Game Boy, GBA, and Nintendo 64. That impressive collection has just grown a little bigger, with a classic Donkey Kong game having been added a few days ago.

Nintendo Switch Online Has Just Added Another Donkey Kong Game

Donkey Kong Land 2 Is Now on Switch Online

In 1995, the Rare-developed Donkey Kong Land released for the original Game Boy. An incredibly ambitious project for the time, Donkey Kong Land was a condensed, reworked version of the beloved SNES game Donkey Kong Country . While some bosses were changed and levels were added, Donkey Kong Land was a remarkably successful attempt at capturing the gameplay formula of Donkey Kong Country , so much so that a sequel released just a year later.

Donkey Kong Land 2 launched in September 1996, also for the original Game Boy. Much like its predecessor, Donkey Kong Land 2 attempted to distill a full SNES Donkey Kong game into one tiny Game Pak. Donkey Kong Land 2 is essentially a retooled version of Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest , with it borrowing the SNES game's narrative and many of its stage names, but changing some level designs.

A big change in Donkey Kong Land 2 and its more technically impressive SNES counterpart was the ability to play as Dixie Kong, who could spin her hair to glide. Donkey Kong Land 2 is now available on Nintendo Switch Online.

Another Donkey Kong Game Could Be Right Around the Corner

But the Donkey Kong Land series is actually a trilogy, and that means there's still one entry left to join Nintendo Switch Online's roster. Donkey Kong Land 3 was originally released in 1997, giving fans a portable version of Donkey Kong Country 3: Dixie Kong's Double Trouble! , albeit with changed level layouts once again. With Donkey Kong Land 1 and 2 now on Switch Online, it'd be great if Donkey Kong Land 3 was right behind them, especially as DKL2 was added just four days after its predecessor.

Nintendo Switch Online's Game Boy Library Is Full of Heavy Hitters

With both Donkey Kong Land 1 and 2 now on the service, Nintendo Switch Online's Game Boy/Game Boy Color library is currently sitting at a solid 33 titles. While that's not quite as high as NSO's NES or SNES game count, the vast majority of these Game Boy titles are certified Nintendo classics. From Mega Man 1-5 , to The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX , to Metroid 2: Return of Samus , to Super Mario Land 1 and 2 , to Kirby's Dream Land 1 and 2 , Nintendo Switch Online's Game Boy library is packed with games that must be played, even for those who don't have nostalgia for that particular era of gaming.

item.title: How to Get the Depths Key in Fisch
item.description:
The Depths Expansion brought a brand-new location to Fisch , with a unique bestiary and an expensive fishing rod. But to get there, players have to complete several difficult conditions, one of which is to find a special key. Therefore, in this guide, we will tell you how to get the Depths Key in Fisch .

This item has an Exotic rarity, which makes it incredibly difficult to catch. However, without it, players cannot open the gate separating them from the Depths location in this Roblox experience.

Where to Find the Depths Key in Fisch

Update 1.06.0 made Vertigo the most popular location in Fisch , as it is the entrance to the Depths. But, of course, you can't just walk in there. Instead, players must complete the Vertigo bestiary and get the elusive Depths Key in the same location in Fisch .

So, your first task is to get to the Vertigo location. This place is deep underwater, so it is impossible to get there by ship. Therefore, you need to wait for the strange whirlpool to appear. Luckily, players receive a notification when such a whirlpool spawns.

After that, you need to find the strange whirlpool, which differs from the others by a beam of light beating from the center. Jump into it, and you will get to Vertigo, the only place where you can catch the Depths Key in Fisch .

As befits an Exotic rarity, catching this item is a real challenge. To get the Depths Key you can use any bait or not use any at all. Also, weather conditions do not matter. In any case, the chance to catch the Depths Key in Fisch will be about 2%.

In other words, you should be prepared to spend a lot of time on this. It is important to note that this is the only way to obtain the Depths Key on your own. However, you can try trading with other players who have already found this Exotic key.

How to Use the Depths Key in Fisch

When you finally get the Depths Key in Fisch , you will most likely have the Vertigo Bestiary completed. After that, you will need to talk to the NPC near the red gate and use the key to open it. However, we do not recommend that you quickly leave the new location. As soon as you log out or change servers, the gate will be closed, and you will have to get another Depths Key to open it.

item.title: 8 Best Historical Fantasy RPGs
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • RPG quality is heavily impacted by the setting.
  • Historical fantasy RPGs take players to past eras.
  • Titles like Nioh, Kingdom Come, and Sekiro offer unique historical settings.

The RPG genre has given players some of the most powerful, important, and moving games in history. Whether they're text-based explorations of a setting or fast-paced ARPGs, roleplaying games have been at the crux of the gaming scene for some time now. The main thing that makes an RPG high-quality is its setting. A fantastic story will still fall flat in an uninspired setting, and conversely, having a world that feels lived in and real can make up for a lot of other missteps in a title.

Many RPGs take the opportunity to tell a story set in a huge fantasy world or a grim dystopic future. But some titles, instead of looking to the future, or into worlds beyond human understanding, look to the past for inspiration. Historical fantasy games blend fantasy elements with settings from humanity's past, often (but not always) including magic. These RPGs in particular take fantastical perspectives on periods in time from humanity's past.

8 Nioh

A Fast-Paced RPG Set In A Mythical Japan

One of those first soulslikes that helped define the genre and its goals, similar to Salt and Sanctuary , Nioh was a fantastic action RPG, with an equally strong sequel. The game focuses on an Irish sailor washing up in a grimdark fantasy Japan.

Yokai have taken advantage of the chaos in this pre-Tokugawa era and are terrorizing the land â€” leaving William Adams, who arrives in pursuit of an old and bitter longtime foe, to defeat the Yokai with swordsmanship and fast reflexes. This title is an excellent take on a historical setting that incorporates its own myths in an engaging way.

7 Kingdom Come: Deliverance

A Fantastical Hero's Journey In Bohemia

Kingdom Come: Deliverance prides itself on the lack of fantastical elements in the game, being one of the most grounded RPGs of its era with a great emphasis on historical authenticity and combat.

This doesn't make Henry's story any less fantastical, however. This is a classic coming of age tale worked into the Hero's Journey. Players who want to see an authentic historical Bohemia will be hard-pressed to find a title that tops this game... at least until the sequel comes out.

6 Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

A Grim And Dangerous Exploration Of Japan

Saying that Sekiro felt like a passion project of FromSoft's might feel disingenuous, as all games from this storied developer are imbued with passion. Yet, the game still feels like the developers wanted a specific story to tell in this rich historical period, owing to how different it feels from other FromSoft titles.

With some fantastic combat, great puzzle bosses, and a rich take on Sengoku-era Japan (slightly earlier than Nioh 's time period), this is one of the best historical fantasy titles players can get their hands on today.

5 Assassin's Creed: Odyssey

An RPG Fueled By Greek Myths

Assassin's Creed: Odyssey was one of those titles that will probably be considered anomalous one day in the great Ubisoft timeline. It's an Assassin's Creed title that is focused almost entirely on RPG elements, to the point that the "assassin" part of things becomes optional.

Regardless, the game is still a rich exploration of Hellenic Greece. It's a fantastic title that lets players interact with the gods and shape fate with immense detail and nuance.

4 Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines

A Gothic Celebration Of The 90s

Children of the 90s, please, do not begin to weep and watch your hair fall out. This title is not here to call anyone old. The 90s is still a contemporary time period, but it's one that technological and social developments have clearly left in the past. That makes this game a very interesting time capsule.

Exploring the rebellious era of the 90s through the violent, bloody world of vampirism is this game's strong suit. RPG fans all over have fallen in love with this title because of the diversity of its options in quest and story design.

3 The Thaumaturge

An Amazing, Magical CRPG

This dark and slick CRPG features some excellent design choices. Set in 20th Century Warsaw, this game takes an excellent spin on both magical realism and historical realism. There are elements of body horror here that make the game a confronting, but compelling affair.

Playing a clandestine mage during a tumultuous time in history is one of the most interesting tacks taken by a CRPG. And yet, and the classic return to form for the genre is something players will not want to miss.

2 Vampyr

An Amazing Atmosphere And a Great Story

If Vampyr has one core message to drive home to players, it's that being good is not always easy. Post-WWI London is a fascinating time period for players to explore as a member of the undead, and Vampyr's unique mechanics make it one of the greats.

Players can either try to get the most out of the blood feeding system, learning about their prey before feeding on them. Alternatively, they can try and struggle to resist their newfound dark urge, and be weaker because of it.

1 Pentiment

Obsidian's Story Is Like No Other

Everything about Pentiment is fantastic. The art style is iconic, the time period is interesting and not often touched upon in video games, and the story is one of the best ever put to a game, by the masters of narrative RPGs at Obsidian.

This historical fantasy game will leave players enthralled with the unique world of Pentiment, and will also give them a broader understanding of the job that an Illustrator truly had in that time period.

item.title: Dress To Impress: How To Save Outfits
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Save Outfit In Dress To Impress
  • How To Wear Pre-Made Outfits In Dress To Impress
  • How To Delete Saved Outfits In Dress To Impress

The latest Halloween Update brought plenty of fresh things to Robloxâ€™s Dress To Impress , which includes new clothes, accessories, pose packs, and even the option to save your outfits.

Before this update, DTI models could create glamorous looks by layering clothes and wearing items like Teddy Bear, Coconut, Apple, Doll, and more, but there was no way to save them. Even those who spent a lot of time creating fun hacks couldnâ€™t save them. But now, you can store your outfits and easily put them on whenever you want. Check out this guide to learn how to save outfits in Dress To Impress .

How To Save Outfit In Dress To Impress

To save outfits in Dress To Impress , players need to use the Dressing Pods located in the main dressing room and save them in the wardrobe section. Once you have created your look, follow these steps to store it in the game:

  • First, find the Dressing Pods . Just head straight from the VIP room until you spot the skin tones booths on the right, then turn left to see the pods.
  • Next, approach a Dressing Pod and click the â€˜Eâ€™ mini-heart to enter it.
  • Once youâ€™re inside the pod, tap the â€˜Wardrobeâ€™ icon , which is represented by a brown closet and a pink dress.
  • Finally, click on the â€˜Plusâ€™ icon , give your outfit a name, and hit â€˜Saveâ€™ to store it.

And a quick heads-up: Saving your outfit includes everything youâ€™re wearing, like dress, accessories, hairstyle, and even makeup.

How To Wear Pre-Made Outfits In Dress To Impress

After saving your outfits in DTI, you can equip them by going back to the Wardrobe section in the Dressing Pods, tapping on your outfitâ€™s name under the â€˜Plusâ€™ button, and hitting the â€˜Wearâ€™ icon. You can also change the color of your dress or remove items and accessories by pressing the â€˜Yellow Mannequinâ€™ icon in the pod.

Moreover, the Dressing Pods showcase your code items and things youâ€™ve purchased with in-game money or Robux, so you can quickly give your avatar a fresh touch. Just remember, pre-made outfits can only be worn in Free Play mode, but you can save them in both Free Play and regular (competition) modes.

How To Delete Saved Outfits In Dress To Impress

To delete your saved looks in Dress To Impress , head to the â€˜Wardrobeâ€™ section in the dressing booths, select the outfit you want to remove, and hit the â€˜Deleteâ€™ button . Youâ€™ll need to confirm your choice by tapping â€˜Confirm,â€™ so make sure to do so; otherwise, it wonâ€™t be erased.

Currently, the DTI wardrobe allows you to store up to 35 outfits. If you want to save new looks, youâ€™ll need to delete some older ones. Also, if you delete a look while wearing it, it wonâ€™t unequip, so you can easily re-save it if needed.

item.title: The Best Harry Potter Games Of All Time
item.description: Harry Potter has had a few titles well before the introduction of Hogwarts Legacy to the mix. But how do they all stack up against each other? Let's find out.
